Description: Two joined fragments of upper part of a black-figure painted pottery situla. Forepart of winged horse. Purple on bridle, front part of wing, feathers.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Findspot number '18' pencilled inside. The forelegs may have been bent up in front as on Pl. GB 591, 3; but it seems more likely that the horse was getting to its feet (much as the ram and bull of Pl. GB 598, 7-8).
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (GB 604, 12.) (Group C 27)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 14)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 267)
